oai_dc:dc.dc:descriptions: Various statements are given with regard to the nature and movements of the celestial bodies. The first of these treats of the Moon and Stars, ending with the 'Bushman rice' Star Canopus (B I. 291
294); the second treats of Sun, Moon, and Stars (B II. 377 379); and the third, of the same (L II. 1. 214 and 215). Prayer to the Star, probably to Canopus, the 'Bushman
1. 216 and 217.) Also mentioned are the woman, man and child stars who run into the clouds. These stars go about while people sleep at night.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sun, Moon and stars
